CORSTORPHINE.

THE parish of Corstorphine‚ anciently written Crostorfyn, lies in the valley between the Pentland and the Corstorphine hills, about three miles west of Edinburgh. Previously to the reign of David the First, in the year 1128, when he founded the Abbey of Holyrood‚ there existed a ehapel connected with the maner of Corstorphine, and subordinate to the church of St. Cuthbert, Edinburgh.
